text:
I have written a JavaSampler which works fine except that the response data is
not displayed in the "ResponseData" tab of the ViewResultTree Listener.

I have set the response data with the following instruction :
            result.setSamplerData( dump( ...));
            result.setResponseMessage( txt);
            result.setResponseData( txt.getBytes());
just before the result.sampleEnd(), where result is the SampleResult variable.

However, when I look at the tabs of the ViewResultTree listener :
    - Sampler result is OK : I find my response message
    - Request is OK : I find my request
    - Response data is empty whereas I should find the content od my txt variable.
creator: bonnemains@csf.fr
bonnemains@csf.fr
text:
Created attachment 18849
SubClass of SleepTest, that shows the bug

In this very simple JavaSampler, I set the ResponseData to e String "Yeah", but
when I run it, I can't see the "Yeah" String in the ViewResultTree ResponseData
tab.
You need to set the type to TEXT
creator: sebb@apache.org
bonnemains@csf.fr
bonnemains@csf.fr
text:
Created attachment 18851
SubClass of SleepTest that shows the bug

I have added a line that set the result content type to SampleResult.TEXT, as
suggested Sebb.

creator: bonnemains@csf.fr
bonnemains@csf.fr
text:
result.setDataType(TEXT); leads to the following error

ERROR: MySleepTest.java:11: No variable or field with this name could be found
at this location.

That is quite normal because there is no variable TEXT in my program. To which
variable or constant TEXT do refer ?

creator: bonnemains@csf.fr
text:
As I told you in my (Comment #5 From Jean-Marc  2006-09-12 13:10 ), I have
already inserted this statement in my program. You can see it in the
attachment(id=18851). Unfortunately, it doesn't work. The responseData tab of
the viewResultTreeListener is always empty.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Your code: result.setContentType( SampleResult.TEXT)

I said to use:   result.setDataType( SampleResult.TEXT);

creator: bonnemains@csf.fr
text: Well, it works fine now. Thank you for your time.
